tn.ref: How beautiful your feet appear in your sandals
tn.text: It is implied by continuing from [[:en:bible:notes:sng:06:13|6:13]] that the woman's lover is describing her as she dances. AT: "Your feet are so very beautiful in your sandals as you dance." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Though the woman was not born into a royal family, the way she looks and acts cause her to seem to be the daughter of a prince. AT: "you who have a noble character" or "you who are elegant." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The curves of your thighs are like jewels
tn.text: The shape of the woman's thighs are like a beautiful precious stone which a skilled workman carved into the perfect shape. AT: "The curves of your thighs are beautiful like the beautiful curves of jewel that a skill craftsman made." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
The word "thighs" refers to the hips of a woman and the part of her legs that is above her knee.
The young woman's lover continues describing the one he loves.

tn.ref: Your navel is like a round bowl
tn.text: The woman's navel is perfectly shaped like a bowl. AT: "Your belly button is shaped perfectly like a round bowl." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
the indented spot on the stomach, which is the scar left from the cord that attached a baby to its mother

tn.ref: may it never lack mixed wine
tn.text: People used large bowls to mix wine with water or snow for a feast. People enjoyed the taste of wine at a feast. AT: "may I always enjoy its beauty" or "may people always rejoice in its beauty." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: Your belly is like a mound of wheat
tn.text: People thought that the color of wheat was the most beautiful color of skin and that the round piles of wheat were beautiful. AT: "Your belly has a beautiful color and is round like a pile of wheat."
This is a pile of the grains of wheat after people thresh and winnow the wheat.
The beautiful flowers make the pile of wheat seem even more beautiful. AT: "that has lilies all around it." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
a type of large flowers
The young woman's lover continues describing the one he loves.

tn.ref: Your two breasts are like two fawns, twins of a gazelle
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:sng:04:04|5:5]].

tn.ref: Your neck is like a tower of ivory
tn.text: The lover compares her neck to a tower made of ivory. (Simile: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
the white tusk or tooth of an animal that is similar to bone. People use ivory to make art and to make things look beautiful.

tn.ref: eyes like the pools in Heshbon
tn.text: AT: "your eyes are clear and sparkle like the pools of water in Heshbon."
the name of a city east of the Jordan River. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
the name of a city (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: nose is like the tower in Lebanon
tn.text: Her nose is long and straight just like the tower is tall and straight.
"that allows people to look toward Damascus"
The lover continues to describe the one he loves.

tn.ref: head on you is like Carmel
tn.text: The woman is compared to Mount Carmel that rises up above everything else around it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Possible translations are 1) "dark black" or 2) "dark red."

tn.ref: The king is held captive by its tresses
tn.text: AT: "Your hair that hangs down is so beautiful that the king is not able to stop admiring it." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
the clusters of hair that hang down from a woman's head. You can also translate this word as "locks" or "curls" or "ringlets."
The lover describes what he would like to do with the one he loves.

tn.ref: Your height is like that of a date palm tree
tn.text: "You stand up like a date palm tree." The woman is tall, stands straight, and is attractive just like a date palm. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
a tall, straight tree that produces a sweet, brown, and sticky fruit that grows in groups

tn.ref: your breasts like clusters of fruit
tn.text: The dates on a palm tree grow in very large and beautiful bunches that hang down from the tree.

tn.ref: I want to climb ... its branches
tn.text: The man wants to hold the woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: May your breasts be like clusters of grapes
tn.text: The man wants to touch her breasts that are firm but soft just like grapes that are full of their juice.

tn.ref: may the fragrance of your nose be like apricots
tn.text: "may the breath coming from your nose smell sweet like apricots."
The word "apricots" refers to tasty, yellow-colored, sweet pieces of fruit.
The lover continues describing what he would like to do with the one he loves.

tn.ref: May your mouth be like the best wine
tn.text: AT: "I want to taste your mouth like the best wine. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"that flows smoothly for the one I love." The lover enjoys the smooth kisses of the woman.

tn.ref: gliding over our lips and teeth
tn.text: "that flows over my lips and teeth" or "slides over our lips and teeth."
See how you translated "I belong to my lover" in [[:en:bible:notes:sng:06:02|6:3]].
"and he is passionate about me" or "and he wants me"
The woman continues to speak to her beloved.
"get up early" or "wake up early"
"are in the beginning of blooming"
flowers when they are open
"have flowers open on the plant"

tn.ref: I will give you my love
tn.text: "I will show you my love" or "I will make love with you"
The woman continues to speak to her beloved.

This is the name of plants that give off a strong but pleasant scent. The scent is slightly intoxicating and stimulating which increases the desire to make love. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"produce their scent"
It is implied that the doors belong to their house. AT: "above the entrances of our house" or "by the doors of our house." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: are all sorts of choice fruits, new and old
tn.text: "is every kind of the best fruit, both old fruit and new fruit"
"saved for you" or "protected for you"
